title: London Stock Exchange shrugs off tough Hong Kong battle to post sales jump
text:
The London Stock Exchange bounced back from a takeover battle with Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing (HKEX) by unveiling a jump in revenues.

HKEX ditched its £32bn bid for the exchange just over a week ago after the LSE's management refused to engage with it and shareholders held out for a higher offer.

On Friday, the LSE revealed it grew third quarter revenues to £521m, an increase of 12pc against the same period last year.

The stellar performance was bolstered by strong growth in its clearing services division which increased sales by a fifth.

LSE also announced that finance boss David Warren will step down by the end of 2020.
